title: Kansas Land Cover — 1936 (Dust Bowl Era Baseline)
description: Historical land cover for Kansas circa 1936 derived from 1930s USDA/NRCS aerial photography and contemporaneous USGS historic topos. Intended for time-aware overlays against modern land cover to visualize Dust Bowl-era vegetation, cropland extent, wetlands, and prairie remnants.
license: Open/Public as provided by each source (see per-asset). County or archive usage notes may apply to aerial scans.

providers.name: USDA Aerial Photography Field Office (APFO) / NRCS
USGS EarthExplorer / Historical Aerials & Topographic Maps

aerial_orthos_1936.title: USDA/NRCS historical aerial photos (1930s, APFO) via USGS EarthExplorer
aerial_orthos_1936.kfm:notes: Download county blocks (circa 1935–1938). Georeference & mosaic for classification.

usgs_historic_topo.title: USGS Historic Topographic (reference symbology)
usgs_historic_topo.kfm:notes: Use to corroborate wetlands, timber, orchards, and surface water features.

processing.notes: Georeference & mosaic 1930s USDA aerials; assist with historic USGS topo symbology; classify (manual/ML-assisted) to KFM-LC-1936-v1; export raster & vector generalized polygons. Store interpreter confidence and provenance per feature.
